column4: question: firefox and pidgin stopped working. the windows are unresponsive. replacing .mozilla doesn't seem to affect it.
did you try to reboot? what did it happen after?
the behavior persists after reboots
did you try to uninstall these two applications? and to install them again?
no, because they work fine when I'm logged in as a different user
what did you do for them to stop working? i mean if you create a new user, they will work fine, but if you do some action X, they stop working. can you remember what X was?
no. no changes whatsoever
create a new user. will new user have the problem?
probably not
I'll try installing/uninstalling firefox,
you know where to start Firefox Safe Mode on Ubuntu?
no, not
not uninstall Firefox
find Firefox Safe Mode menu somewhere
I run openbox
firefox --safe-mode
path/to/firefox.exe --safe-mode
same problem
firefox safe mode does not work and has the same failure mode as running firefox
create a new user and delete this one. this one is defective. me know why? no. or just hang on, maybe somebody will help you. me is not Ubuntu user yet. you can also try irc://moznet/firefox
this is the user that I've been using for months, and I can't easily just delete it
